Package remodel.io

Class ExpressionReader

java.lang.Object
remodel.io.AbstractReader
remodel.io.ExpressionReader
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.io.Closeable, java.lang.AutoCloseable, TokenCodes
Direct Known Subclasses:
MetamodelReader, TransformReader
public abstract class ExpressionReader
extends AbstractReader
implements TokenCodes
ExpressionReader is the abstract ancestor of parsers which analyse code expressions. The descendants of ExpressionReader are MetamodelReader and TransformReader. ExpressionReader accepts tokens and segmented text from a ModelScanner and parses these into an Expression-tree representing the call-graph of the body of an Operation. The root of the returned parse-tree is typically an instance of CompoundExpression.

ExpressionReader implements the Closeable interface (by inheriting from AbstractReader), so may be used in try-with-resources blocks, in order to ensure that the ExpressionReader and all underlying input streams are closed safely.

Version:
1.0
Author:
Anthony J H Simons

  • Constructor Details

    • ExpressionReader

      public ExpressionReader​(java.io.File file) throws java.io.FileNotFoundException
      Creates an ExpressionReader reading input from the given File. Uses the default character encoding UTF-8.
      Parameters:
      file - the input File.
      Throws:
      java.io.FileNotFoundException - if the file cannot be found.

    • ExpressionReader

      public ExpressionReader​(java.io.File file, java.lang.String encoding) throws java.io.FileNotFoundException, java.io.UnsupportedEncodingException
      Creates an ExpressionReader reading input from the given file, using the given character encoding. Possible encodings include UTF-8, UTF-16 or ISO-8859-1 (Latin-1).
      Parameters:
      file - the input File.
      encoding - the expected character encoding.
      Throws:
      java.io.FileNotFoundException - if the file cannot be found.
      java.io.UnsupportedEncodingException - if the encoding is not supported.
